title: If At First You Don't Succeed...

options.text: "I'm sure we'll have the benefit of your wise guidance for many years to come, @@LEADER@@," says your Chief of Staff @@RANDOM_NAME@@, "but just in case the worst should happen, would you mind letting us know who should fill your mighty shoes? Not that such a gargantuan task would be easy, of course."
options.result: the leaders of @@NAME@@ are given the nod by their predecessors

options.text: "In the event of your unfortunate demise," suggests your brother as he surreptitiously replaces your recuperative health drink with finest scotch, "@@NAME@@ will need someone to look up to. Let's face it, the country is full of wastrels who need a firm hand. That's why an absolute monarch, with final authority over every aspect of @@DEMONYM_ADJECTIVE@@ life, is the answer. After all, such a monarch can always choose the right trusted, older candidate of proven loyalty and ability to succeed them. I think I know just the man..."
options.result:
some @@DEMONYMNOUNPLURAL@@ have nicknamed the monarch "Caligula"

used to be "@@LEADER@@'s family is riven by conflict as they fight over the succession"

options.text: "No, you mustn't!" cries your sister, yanking the scotch from your hand and handing you a grape. "If there is a monarchy, it must be regulated by limits placed by an elected government. That way, the people still get a say in how their country is run, and the person at the top doesn't get overstressed. Not only that, but think what an unscrupulous person might do given absolute power: bump off loathed relatives, persecute political enemies and even destroy the country." Noticing your brother grinning at her, she remembers she has something to do and sprints out of the room.
options.result: the monarch's main official duty is christening ships

options.text: "You know what I think?" declares @@RANDOM_NAME@@, your chief of security. "All this talk of replacing you is treason, pure and simple! You must eliminate anyone who has even mentioned the succession at once, before they usurp you!"
options.result: a wide-ranging purge of leading officials and family members is being carried out by @@LEADER@@

options.text: "I think science might have the solution," claims your attendant physician @@RANDOM_NAME@@, who couldn't help overhearing the previous conversations. "With adequate funding and the latest medical technologies, my colleagues and I may be able to dramatically increase your lifespan. It'll mean diverting funds from everyone else's healthcare, of course, but what value would their insignificant little lives have without you, O @@LEADER@@, to guide them?"
options.result:
the health budget has been diverted into prolonging @@LEADER@@'s life

used to be "the entire health budget has been diverted into prolonging @@LEADER@@'s life"

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: deadly medical pandemics
policiesAndNotabilities.name: deadly medical pandemics

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "Even death need not be the end!" shouts one of your more fervent acolytes before being taken away for a nice lie down in a darkened room. "Why not declare yourself leader in perpetuity? Then we'll never be without your divine guidance! Think about it. @@LEADER@@... forever!"
options.result: @@LEADER@@ has been declared supreme ruler for all eternity

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

options.text: "Er, excuse me," says your nurse, who has been attending to your intravenous drip and so far remained unnoticed, "but shouldn't it be up to the people to decide who your successor is?"
options.result: @@NAME@@ has taken the radical step of electing its future leaders
